column1: Some things may make phantom pain worse, such as: - Being too tired - Putting too much pressure on the stump or parts of the arm or leg that are still there - Changes in the weather - Stress - Infection - An artificial limb that does not fit properly - Poor blood flow - Swelling in the part of the arm or leg that is still there
Ask your doctor if you can take acetaminophen (Tylenol), aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil or Motrin), or other drugs that help with pain.
